meanings.definition: To make or become unclear or indistinct
meanings.sent1: The rain on the window caused the glass to blur.
meanings.sent2: When I don't wear my glasses, everything starts to blur together.
meanings.sent3: Trying to read without my glasses always makes the words blur into each other.
meanings.sent4: Her tears began to blur the lines between reality and fantasy.
meanings.sent5: The fog was so thick that it seemed to blur the entire landscape.

meanings.definition: A shape or area that cannot be seen clearly or that has fuzzy edges
meanings.sent1: In the distance, I could see a blur of colors that turned out to be a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: The painting was intentionally created with a blur to evoke a sense of mystery.
meanings.sent3: The blur of the distant mountains made them look like a watercolor painting.
meanings.sent4: As the train sped by, the landscape outside the window became a blur of green and brown.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a blur of colors to represent the chaos of the city streets.
